data: RC Residential Care Moving In Orders
If temperature over 38.5 DegC for 24 hours, and if patient presents with cough that lasts longer than 24 hours
Provider must order starting diet. RN or RD to place subsequent diet order
Reason for Consult: Diet per dietitian. May advance or modify
RN to determine diet until diet as per dietitian
Unless Prescriber orders a diet, diet as tolerated (RN to determine) until diet as per Dietitian

PLACEHOLDER - new order kaolin-pectin suspension 30 to 60 mL PO after each loose bowel movement  Indication - DIARRHEA  Maximum 4 doses  If diarrhea persists longer than 12 hours  [link to clear fluid diet]

The following orders to be carried out when resident moves in if order has been selected by prescriber
Tetanus-diphtheria (Td) vaccine is required if resident vaccinated more than 10 years ago or if there is no clear documented history of previous vaccination
0.5 mL, IM, once, drug form: inj

Pneumococcal vaccine is required if resident is not previously vaccinated or if there is no clear documented history of previous vaccination – unless medically contraindicated. At the discretion of the prescriber, residents who are at risk for invasive disease (e.g. chronic kidney, liver, heart, lung disease; immunosuppression) may require revaccination if initially vaccinated more than 5 years ago
0.5 mL, IM, once, drug form: inj
0.5 mL, IM, once, drug form: inj
